metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3600 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
XML external entity (XXE) vulnerability in Apache ActiveMQ 5.x before 5.10.1 allows remote consumers to have unspecified impact via vectors involving an XPath based selector when dequeuing XML messages.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3600` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

activemq - 5.6.0+dfsg-1+deb7u1build0.14.04.1
libactivemq-java - 5.6.0+dfsg-1+deb7u1build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: activemq package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.0+dfsg-1+deb7u1build0.14.04.1').
